revised_title: A Pneumatic Analogue of the Wheatstone Bridge for Fluid Flow
tldr: The author develops a pneumatic analogue of the Wheatstone Bridge to study fluid flow, which can be used to measure the flow of air in ventilation systems and verify the laws of flow. The apparatus consists of three wooden boxes, two orifices, and a detector that can identify the position of equilibrium, allowing for accurate measurements of fluid flow.
